intro: Cirsium sansebastianii, commonly known as San Sebastián thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
